title: How to Make Fruit Sushi

steps.headline: Wash the rice.
steps.description: Empty the rice into a large bowl and fill it up with water. Use your hands to wash the rice until the water appears milky white. Then use a strainer to remove the water.

steps.headline: Cook the rice.
steps.description: Add the water, rice, salt, and sugar to a heavy bottomed saucepan and simmer. Lower the heat and continue to cook the rice for 12-15 minutes.

steps.headline: Add coconut milk.
steps.description: Pour some coconut milk into the rice after the rice has soaked up the water.

steps.headline: Allow the rice to cool.
steps.description: Remove the rice from the pot and transfer onto a lined tray to allow it to cool down.

steps.headline: Cut the fruits.
steps.description: Using a knife cut the fruit into long sticks just like sushi fillings are cut.

steps.headline: Spread rice onto plastic wrap.
steps.description: Scoop some of the rice either with your hands or with a spoon into a rectangular shape.

steps.headline: Place the fruit slices.
steps.description: Carefully put the strips of fruit about 2/3 away from the start of the rice.

steps.headline: Roll the sushi.
steps.description: Once you've added all the desired fruits roll the sushi tightly but carefully into a log like shape, making sure it doesn't unravel.

steps.headline: To serve.
steps.description: Place the sushi rolls onto a plate, alongside thinly sliced cantaloupe as pickled ginger and fresh fruit purée as soy sauce. Don't forget to eat with chopsticks!

text: Wash the rice. Empty the rice into a large bowl and fill it up with water. Use your hands to wash the rice until the water appears milky white. Then use a strainer to remove the water. Cook the rice. Add the water, rice, salt, and sugar to a heavy bottomed saucepan and simmer. Lower the heat and continue to cook the rice for 12-15 minutes. Add coconut milk. Pour some coconut milk into the rice after the rice has soaked up the water. Allow the rice to cool. Remove the rice from the pot and transfer onto a lined tray to allow it to cool down. Cut the fruits. Using a knife cut the fruit into long sticks just like sushi fillings are cut. Spread rice onto plastic wrap. Scoop some of the rice either with your hands or with a spoon into a rectangular shape. Place the fruit slices. Carefully put the strips of fruit about 2/3 away from the start of the rice. Roll the sushi. Once you've added all the desired fruits roll the sushi tightly but carefully into a log like shape, making sure it doesn't unravel. To serve. Place the sushi rolls onto a plate, alongside thinly sliced cantaloupe as pickled ginger and fresh fruit purée as soy sauce. Don't forget to eat with chopsticks!
sentences: Wash the rice.
Empty the rice into a large bowl and fill it up with water.
Use your hands to wash the rice until the water appears milky white.
Then use a strainer to remove the water.
Cook the rice.
Add the water, rice, salt, and sugar to a heavy bottomed saucepan and simmer.
Lower the heat and continue to cook the rice for 12-15 minutes.
Add coconut milk.
Pour some coconut milk into the rice after the rice has soaked up the water.
Allow the rice to cool.
Remove the rice from the pot and transfer onto a lined tray to allow it to cool down.
Cut the fruits.
Using a knife cut the fruit into long sticks just like sushi fillings are cut.
Spread rice onto plastic wrap.
Scoop some of the rice either with your hands or with a spoon into a rectangular shape.
Place the fruit slices.
Carefully put the strips of fruit about 2/3 away from the start of the rice.
Roll the sushi.
Once you've added all the desired fruits roll the sushi tightly but carefully into a log like shape, making sure it doesn't unravel.
To serve.
Place the sushi rolls onto a plate, alongside thinly sliced cantaloupe as pickled ginger and fresh fruit purée as soy sauce.
Don't forget to eat with chopsticks!
